Hi,
I've got about 250 JUnit tests so far for my little system, and
it is working great. But....

I've got two flavors to test. one with a real JDCB database
connection, and a fake-connection one for when there
is no SQL database to connect to.

These are controlled by a property and there is a singleton
instance containing all the properties.

But so far, when I want to test both cases, I edit the
property file, fire up JUnit, look at the results
and then change the property file to the other value,
repeat.

Is there a clean way to automate it? I can clearly have the
JUnit setup() tell the property singleton to lie, but
how do I get all the tests to fire up again?

Maybe I could write a meta test package that sets the control
one way, fires up all the rest of the tests, set it the other way
and repeat? I'm not sure even where to look for sample code to
drive this.

If it helps, I'm using Netbeans 5.0 and its internally generated ant
scripts to fire off the tests.

Thanks
Pat
